alert.note: Alert for Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 02 at 4:09PM MDT until September 02 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WESTERN KANE AND EASTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 409 PM MDT, gauge reports indicated a flash flood wave on the East Fork of the Virgin River. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, slot canyons and normally dry washes. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park, Parunuweap Canyon, and the East Fork of the Virgin River from through Zion National Park to the confluence with the mainstem Virgin River. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
